block.p: Dexterrie Clemente Ramirez, a daughter of Terrie and Dexter Ramirez of Diamond Bar, Calif., was married yesterday to Robin Hom, a son of Ann Hsiung and Sandy K. Hom of Manhattan. The Rev. John Davis, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at University Parish, Church of St. Joseph in Manhattan.

Ms. Ramirez, 29, is keeping her name. Last month she completed her first year at the City University of New York School of Law at Queens College, and is now a summer legal intern for Justice Lottie E. Wilkins of New York Supreme Court in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of California, Los Angeles, and received a master's degree in educational psychology from New York University.

Dexterrie Clemente Ramirez, a daughter of Terrie and Dexter Ramirez of Diamond Bar, Calif., was married yesterday to Robin Hom, a son of Ann Hsiung and Sandy K. Hom of Manhattan. The Rev. John Davis, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at University Parish, Church of St. Joseph in Manhattan.

Ms. Ramirez, 29, is keeping her name. Last month she completed her first year at the City University of New York School of Law at Queens College, and is now a summer legal intern for Justice Lottie E. Wilkins of New York Supreme Court in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of California, Los Angeles, and received a master's degree in educational psychology from New York University.

Her father is a senior pharmaceutical sales representative in Diamond Bar for GlaxoSmithKline, the British drug company. Her mother is a community program director in the business services and marketing division of the City of Los Angeles.

Mr. Hom, 27, a University of Maryland graduate, is a middle-school mathematics teacher at the Berkeley Carroll School in Brooklyn and is a basketball, volleyball and softball coach there. He is also a candidate for a master's in mathematics education at City College in Manhattan.
His mother is a lawyer in Manhattan and his father is a judge on the Immigration Court, also in Manhattan.
